message.content:
Step 1: Determine the difference in ages between you and your sister at the time of the question. You are currently 80 years old and your sister is half your age, so her current age would be 80 / 2 = 40 years old.

Step 2: Subtract the difference in ages from the present day to find out how old your sister was when you were 6 years old. Since the difference between your current age and your sister's current age is 40 - 80 = -40, your sister was 40 + 40 = 80 years old when you were 6.

So, your sister is now 80 years old.
